content.heading: Main Procedure
Step 1: Initial Rinse
content.paragraph: Rinse the bicycle with water to remove loose dirt and debris.
content.reference: Refer to Figure 1 for visual guidance.
content.heading: Step 2: Detailed Cleaning
content.paragraph: Use a brush to access hard-to-reach areas such as shifters, tires, and brakes.
Remove caked grime from the chain and sprockets using a small blade screwdriver.
content.heading: Step 3: Degreasing
content.paragraph: Remove grease from the freewheel assembly using a degreasing agent.
Apply the degreaser to the following parts:

list.item: Guide and tension wheels of the derailleur

content.heading: Step 4: Rinsing
content.paragraph: Flush the sprockets, derailleurs, chainrings, and chain with water.
Repeat the flushing process if necessary.
content.heading: Alternative Washing Procedures
content.paragraph: The following washing procedures are tailored based on the bicycle type (defined by `applicRefId`):
content.heading: Bicycle Type: app-0002
content.paragraph: Soak a sponge in detergent and water.
Clean the bicycle with the soaked sponge.
Thoroughly flush the bicycle to remove all detergent residue.
Move the bicycle up and down on its tires to remove excess water.

content.heading: Closing Requirements
content.paragraph: Ensure the bicycle is completely dry before use.
content.heading: Safety Precautions
content.caution: Detergent/Degreaser: Do not allow detergent or degreaser to come into contact with your eyes. If contact occurs, rinse immediately with clean water. Follow instructions on the container for proper usage.
Water Hose: Do not use a high-pressure water hose, as it may damage components.
Hub/Bottom Bracket: Avoid directing the water hose directly at the hub or bottom bracket bearings.
Paint: Apply detergent/degreaser in accordance with the container's instructions. Improper application may damage the bicycle's paint.
